citation: Proclamation under the Local Government (Building and Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 1993 (Tas)
text:
Proclamation under the Local Government (Building and Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 1993

I, the Governor in and over the State of Tasmania and its Dependencies in the Commonwealth of Australia, acting with the advice of the Executive Council and on the petition of the Southern Midlands Council, by this my proclamation made under section 198 of the Local Government (Building and Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 1993 â€“

        (a) declare an area of land in the municipal area of Southern Midlands to be a restricted supply water district, the limits of which are defined in Schedule 1 to this proclamation; and
        (b) name that restricted supply water district the Bagdad and Mangalore Restricted Supply Water District; and
        (c) revoke the proclamation notified in the Gazette as Statutory Rules 1990, No. 26; and
        (d) declare that this proclamation takes effect on the day on which its making is notified in the Gazette.
21 December 1998

G. S. M. Green

Governor

By His Excellency's Command,

P. A. Lennon

Minister for Infrastructure, Energy and Resources

SCHEDULE 1 - Bagdad and mangalore restricted supply water district

All that area of land in the municipal area of Southern Midlands shown bounded by a heavy black line on the 3 drawings of Plan No. 4139 in the Central Plan Register, reduced copies of which are set out, by way of illustration only, in Schedule 2 to this proclamation.

SCHEDULE 2 - Plan

Displayed and numbered in accordance with the Rules Publication Act 1953.

Notified in the Gazette on 30 December 1998

This proclamation is administered in the Department of Infrastructure, Energy and Resources.
